name: D-Function
statement: Let $$$D(n)$$$ represent the sum of digits of $$$n$$$. For how many integers $$$n$$$ where $$$10^{l} \leq n < 10^{r}$$$ satisfy $$$D(k \cdot n) = k \cdot D(n)$$$? Output the answer modulo $$$10^9+7$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 10^4$$$) â€“ the number of test cases. Each test case contains three integers $$$l$$$, $$$r$$$, and $$$k$$$ ($$$0 \leq l < r \leq 10^9$$$, $$$1 \leq k \leq 10^9$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, output an integer, the answer, modulo $$$10^9 + 7$$$.
